article_title: How The Obama Administration Raided The Treasury To Pay Off Insurers

article_metadata.description: The Obama administration has unlawfully given billions of dollars to private insurers, on whose continued cooperation the Affordable Care Act depends, via a patently bogus interpretation of a statute that was supposed to go to the Treasury to pay off money spent on another part of the ACA. It has done so by reversing the priorities the statute attaches to an earmarked pot of money and then mysteriously collecting only enough money from various health plans to pay off the insurers selling policies on the Exchanges, not the other claimants on the fund.
article_metadata.author: The Apothecary
